title: Mexico's president acknowledges distrust, fear
text:
Mexico City - Mexican President Enrique Pena Nieto acknowledged on Wednesday that the country's crime, corruption and economic troubles have caused distrust and anger among Mexicans.
While Pena Nieto stressed his administration's achievements in structural reforms and government programmes, his state-of-the-nation address on Wednesday contained a dose of realism.
Pena Nieto began the annual speech by mentioning the disappearance of 43 students in 2014, and the escape of drug lord Joaquin "El Chapo" Guzman.
"The last year has been a difficult one for Mexico," he said. "Our country has been deeply wounded by a series of regrettable cases."
